overview: Buck French is a serial CEO and business management entrepreneur. Over his career, he has led several technology companies to commercial success. He founded OnLink Technologies, which he grew and sold to Siebel Systems for $609M. Buck was also CEO and Chairman of Securify, which he grew to become one of the leading security vendors in its sector, which led to the acquisition by Secure Computing (later acquired by McAfee). Buck has also served as partner at technology venture capital firm JPMorgan Partners, and held the role of VP/GM of the Interactive Selling business unit at Siebel. He holds an MBA from Harvard University and a BS in Economics and General Engineering from the U.S. Military Academy at West Point.

degrees.subject: Economics and General Engineering
degrees.institution: U.S. Military Academy at West Point
